item.title: Why Busy Beaver hunters fear the Antihydra
Avoid 2:00 and 3:00 am cron jobs (2013)
item.description:
Avoid 2:00 and 3:00 am cron jobs. Most of the time such cron jobs will run fine, but if they run every Sunday morning, then twice per year they will run at the exact time daylight savings time (aka summer time) kicks in or ends, sometimes with very strange results. On Linux with vixie-cron we saw two cron jobs run something like once per second between 3:00 and 3:01 when the most recent daylight savings time began.

Read more

item.title: JSON Query
item.description:
JSON Query supports all basic operators. An object is defined as a regular JSON object with a property name as key, and a query as value. A property retrieves a property from an object.

Read more

item.title: Sieve (YC X25) Is Hiring Engineers to build video datasets for frontier AI
item.description:
Purpose-built video understanding models paired with human QA help find just the highest quality, training-ready data. Our growing library consists of thousands of petabytes of video data. Purpose-built video understanding models paired with human QA help find just the highest quality, training-ready data.

Read more

item.title: fnox, a secret manager that pairs well with mise
item.description:
pub $ fnox secret set API_KEY --value "your-secret-value" --provider main Use secrets in your workflow: # Export secrets as environment variables $ fnox exec -- your-command # Get a single secret $ fnox get API_KEY # Shell integration (auto-load secrets on cd) $ fnox shell hook How It Works with mise fnox and mise work independently but complement each other: mise: Manages tools, tasks, and general environment variables fnox: Manages sensitive secrets with encryption and remote storage A typical setup: mise. You might wonder why fnox isn't built into mise. What's going to happen to mise secrets.

Read more

item.title: Show HN: Erdos â€“ open-source, AI data science IDE
item.description:
Erdos lets data scientists create, edit, and iterate on Jupyter notebooks faster and more accurately than ever before. Erdosâ€™s AI assistant reads and interprets documentation from the help pane to deliver contextually accurate help, examples, and explanations. We only charge for usage of the Erdos AI assistant.

item.title: Why Nigeria Accepted GMOs
item.description:
Before 2011, the majority of GM crops were grown in the global North; in countries like the U. 8 million hectares,â€ according to a 2024 review article,â€ with developing countries accounting for 54. However, yields are being decimated by drought and a variety of pests that have become more prevalent with shifting climes.

Read more

item.description:

item.title: Life next to 199 data centres
item.description:
Meiying Wu/BBCA data centre in Loudoun County. Annually, the data centre industry creates about 74,000 jobs, totalling $5. Virginia's Governor, Glenn Youngkin, vetoed state legislation that would have regulated the centres earlier this year.

item.title: Carl Bohland's Auto Wash Bowl (2019)
item.description:
On a busy Saturday, about 75 cars per hour would go for a spin in the wash bowl. The first Auto Wash Bowl in Chicago was built by a Chicagoan named C. Just two years later, the North Side wash bowl was bought by a local realtor, the South Side wash bowl was gone by the â€˜30s, and the Auto Wash Bowl went down the drain.

Read more
